abstract: An American soldier has allegedly slaughtered 16 Afghan civilians, nine of them children. What is almost never considered in such cases is a trial in the country where the crime took place. It's one of the reasons why the United States "unjoined" the International Criminal Court. But is a trial in situ really so crazy? Why not a joint military tribunal conducted by U.S. forces and the Afghan National Army?

headline.main: Why Not a Massacre Tribunal in Afghanistan?
